channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sterling plunges 1% against the dollar, euro after Bank of England governor's comments on rate policy
item.description: Sterling was down 1.06% to $1.3126 at 9:22 a.m. in London.

item.title: Who has time for a power lunch? The real business happens at 4 P.M. ‘power hour.’
item.description: In the post-covid era, the bars of some of Manhattan's most elegant restaurants are packed by 4:30 p.m. Just don't call it "happy hour."

item.title: Starbucks invests in two innovation farms to help climate-proof its coffee
item.description: The coffee giant buys 3% of the world's coffee supply, which has been pressured in recent years due to extreme weather.

item.title: Costco now sells platinum bars, but some finance pros say they aren’t a sure bet
Turkish inflation on a downward trend—a delight for consumers but a disappointment for policymakers
item.description: Turkish annual inflation slowed less than expected in September to 49.4%.

item.title: ‘Sell Rosh Hashanah, buy Yom Kippur’ strategy faces tricky October stock market
Oura announces new smart ring with updated design and new sensors for $349
item.description: Oura announced the Oura Ring 4, which is available for preorder starting at $349.

item.title: UK house sales rise since the Covid-19 boom as lower mortgage rates spur activity
item.description: Lower mortgage rates are sparking an uptick in the U.K. housing market, with home sales rising last month at the fastest pace since the post-lockdown ...

item.title: How OPEC+ could soften the blow if the Middle East conflict hits supply
Auto giants are getting nervous about the prospect of mega fines as EV demand falters
item.description: Europe's top car giants appear to be increasingly concerned about the prospect of massive fines, particularly as electric vehicle demand falters.

item.title: Stocks rise in Japan while the yen and U.K. pound fall on dovish interest rate talk
item.description: Japan jumped while Hong Kong and Europe stumbled as Israel pushed into Lebanon and Middle East tensions grew. China’s markets remained closed for Gold...

item.title: Dutch airline KLM will do ‘everything’ it can to protect jobs in cost-cutting drive
item.description: KLM CEO Marjan Rintel said the measures would be "painful for every KLM colleague, but it is necessary, and it has to be done now."

item.title: U.S. stocks end slightly higher after choppy trading as inflation worries return
Opinion: OpenAI doubles its valuation, but has a lot to live up to now
WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert is leading the league to historic highs. Critics wonder if she’s fully seizing the moment
item.description: As the WNBA's banner season wraps up, Engelbert faces more pressure than ever.
